version uses the employee's wallet address as the key instead of an employee ID.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"EnforcedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is paused."}],"ExpectedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is not paused."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addAiAgent(address)":{"params":{"agent":"Address to grant AI agent role to"}},"addEmployee(string,address,uint256)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee\u2019s wallet address.","_name":"The employee\u2019s name.","_salary":"The salary assigned to the employee (in smallest USDC unit)."}},"addEmployeesBatch(string[],address[],uint256[])":{"params":{"_employeeAddresses":"Array of employee addresses.","_names":"Array of employee names.","_salaries":"Array of employee salaries."}},"addFunds(uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"The amount of USDC (in smallest unit) to add."}},"createSchedule(address,uint256,uint256,uint8)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee\u2019s wallet address.","_endDate":"The end timestamp for the schedule.","_interval":"The interval for the schedule.","_startDate":"The start timestamp for the schedule."}},"deactivateEmployee(address)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee\u2019s wallet address."}},"deactivateSchedule(address,uint256)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee's address.","_scheduleId":"The schedule ID to deactivate."}},"getAllEmployeesWithDetails(address)":{"returns":{"_0":"Employee[] An array of Employee structs containing employee details."}},"getEmployeeDetailsByNameAndAddress(address,address,string)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee's address","_employer":"The employer's address","_name":"The employee's name"}},"getEmployerBalance(address)":{"params":{"_employer":"The employer's address."}},"getNextPayrollDate(address,address)":{"returns":{"nextPaymentDate":"The next timestamp when payroll is scheduled."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getTotalEmployees(address)":{"params":{"_employer":"The employer's address"},"returns":{"_0":"total The total number of employees"}},"getTotalPayrollLiability(address)":{"params":{"_employer":"The employer's address."}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"hasSufficientBalanceForPayroll(address)":{"returns":{"_0":"True if the employer's balance is at least the total payroll liability."}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"reactivateEmployee(address)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee's address."}},"removeAiAgent(address)":{"params":{"agent":"Address to revoke AI agent role from"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"updateEmployeeSalary(address,uint256)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee\u2019s wallet address.","_newSalary":"The new salary amount."}},"updateSalariesBatch(address[],uint256[])":{"params":{"_employeeAddresses":"Array of employee addresses.","_newSalaries":"Array of new salaries."}},"updateSchedule(address,uint256,uint8)":{"params":{"_employeeAddress":"The employee\u2019s wallet address.","_interval":"The new interval for the schedule.","_scheduleId":"The schedule ID to update."}},"withdrawFunds(uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"The amount to withdraw."}}},"stateVariables":{"employeeSchedules":{"details":"Key: employer address => employeeAddress => array of Schedule."}},"title":"RikaPayrollManager","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"addAiAgent(address)":{"notice":"Add an AI agent role to an address"},"addEmployee(string,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Adds a new employee for the caller (employer)."},"addEmployeesBatch(string[],address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Adds multiple employees in a single transaction."},"addFunds(uint256)":{"notice":"Adds funds to the caller\u2019s (employer\u2019s) balance."},"createSchedule(address,uint256,uint256,uint8)":{"notice":"Creates a new schedule for an existing employee."},"deactivateEmployee(address)":{"notice":"Deactivates an employee, so they no longer receive payroll."},"deactivateSchedule(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Deactivates a schedule for an employee."},"getAllEmployeesWithDetails(address)":{"notice":"Returns all employees (with details) for a given employer."},"getEmployeeDetails(address,address)":{"notice":"Returns the details of a specific employee."},"getEmployeeDetailsByNameAndAddress(address,address,string)":{"notice":"Returns the details of a specific employee by name and address"},"getEmployerBalance(address)":{"notice":"Returns the employer's available funds."},"getNextPayrollDate(address,address)":{"notice":"Returns the next payroll date for a specific employee."},"getTotalEmployees(address)":{"notice":"Returns the total number of employees for an employer"},"getTotalPayrollLiability(address)":{"notice":"Returns the total monthly payroll liability for an employer."},"hasSufficientBalanceForPayroll(address)":{"notice":"Checks whether the employer has sufficient funds to cover payroll liabilities."},"processAllPayrolls()":{"notice":"Processes payroll for all employees of the caller.         It calculates the total payout needed and then processes payment for each eligible schedule."},"reactivateEmployee(address)":{"notice":"Reactivates a deactivated employee."},"removeAiAgent(address)":{"notice":"Remove an AI agent role from an address"},"updateEmployeeSalary(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Updates an employee's salary."},"updateSalariesBatch(address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Updates salaries for multiple employees in a single transaction."},"updateSchedule(address,uint256,uint8)":{"notice":"Updates the interval for an existing schedule."},"withdrawFunds(uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraws funds from the caller\u2019s (employer\u2019s) balance.         The withdrawal is prevented if a payroll is scheduled soon (within 3 days)."}},"notice":"This contract allows employers to add employees, set up schedules, fund payrolls, process payments, and withdraw excess funds. It uses role-based access control (AccessControl) and can be paused mfDRc7pxfaXB2Dh9np5Uf29Na3pQ7tafRS684wd3GLjVL"]}},"version":1}

params.agent: Address to grant AI agent role to

params._salary: The salary assigned to the employee (in smallest USDC unit).

params._amount: The amount of USDC (in smallest unit) to add.

params._endDate: The end timestamp for the schedule.
params._startDate: The start timestamp for the schedule.

returns._0: Employee[] An array of Employee structs containing employee details.

returns.nextPaymentDate: The next timestamp when payroll is scheduled.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: total The total number of employees

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: True if the employer's balance is at least the total payroll liability.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.agent: Address to revoke AI agent role from

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._interval: The new interval for the schedule.

addAiAgent(address).notice: Add an AI agent role to an address

addEmployee(string,address,uint256).notice: Adds a new employee for the caller (employer).

addEmployeesBatch(string[],address[],uin.notice: Adds multiple employees in a single transaction.

addFunds(uint256).notice: Adds funds to the callers (employers) balance.

createSchedule(address,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Creates a new schedule for an existing employee.

deactivateEmployee(address).notice: Deactivates an employee, so they no longer receive payroll.

deactivateSchedule(address,uint256).notice: Deactivates a schedule for an employee.

getAllEmployeesWithDetails(address).notice: Returns all employees (with details) for a given employer.

getEmployeeDetails(address,address).notice: Returns the details of a specific employee.

getEmployeeDetailsByNameAndAddress(addre.notice: Returns the details of a specific employee by name and address

getNextPayrollDate(address,address).notice: Returns the next payroll date for a specific employee.

getTotalEmployees(address).notice: Returns the total number of employees for an employer

getTotalPayrollLiability(address).notice: Returns the total monthly payroll liability for an employer.

hasSufficientBalanceForPayroll(address).notice: Checks whether the employer has sufficient funds to cover payroll liabilities.

processAllPayrolls().notice: Processes payroll for all employees of the caller.         It calculates the total payout needed and then processes payment for each eligible schedule.

removeAiAgent(address).notice: Remove an AI agent role from an address

updateSalariesBatch(address[],uint256[]).notice: Updates salaries for multiple employees in a single transaction.

updateSchedule(address,uint256,uint8).notice: Updates the interval for an existing schedule.

withdrawFunds(uint256).notice: Withdraws funds from the callers (employers) balance.         The withdrawal is prevented if a payroll is scheduled soon (within 3 days).
